Platform.Title: Escherichia coli 5K oligo microarray
Platform.Description: Escherichia coli 5K oligo microarray produced by Digital Genomics, Inc. Seoul, Korea.

Sample.Title: Transcription profiles of NTG-treated E. coli imp fabI(G93V) and its control strain in the absence of triclosan

Channel.Source: NTG-treated E. coli imp fabI(G93V) [E. coli IFN4]
Channel.Characteristics: contains a 23 codon deletion allele in imp (increased membrane permeability),substitution of the 93th codon of fabI, NTG treatment; fabI(G93V), substitution of Gly(the 93th codon) of fabI with Val, NTG treatment to be high resistance to triclosan
Channel.Growth-Protocol: The cells were cultivated in 100 ml LB broth containing 2 mg/L Cm without triclosan and harvested in mid-logarithmic growth phase (OD600=1.0).
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Total RNA extracted using RNAprotect Bacterial Reagent (Qiagen) and an RNeasy Mini kit (Qiagen).
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: The purified RNA (40 mg) was mixed with 2 mL of bacterial random primer (3 mg/mL), 10mL 5xFirst strand buffer (Invitrogen) 5 mL 0.1M DTT, 1 mL 50xaminoallyl-dNTP mixture (0.5 mM each of dATP, dGTP, dCTP and dTTP), 1mL RNasin (40 U/mL) (Promega) and 2 mL reverse transcriptase (200 U/mL) (Invitrogen), and was incubated at 42°C for 1 h. After a further incubation with 1 mL reverse transcriptase (200 U/mL) at 42 °C for 1 h, 16.5 mL 1M NaOH and 16.5 mL 0.5 M EDTA were added to the mixture and incubated at 65 °C for 15 min to degrade the RNA. HCl (16.5 mL, 1M) was added to neutralize the mixture. The synthesized cDNA mixtures were purified using Microcon YM-30 (Millipore) and eluted. The purified cDNA was mixed with 1 m L 1M Na2CO3 (pH 9.0) and 2 mL Cy3-OSu or Cy5-OSu (Amersham Pharmacia Biotech) and incubated at room temperature for 1 h in the dark. The two labeled cDNA samples to be compared were purified using a QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen), and the eluted cDNA was dried by SpeedVac.

Channel.Characteristics: E. coli imp 4231(G93V), substitution of the 93th codon of fabI
contains a 23 codon detion allele in imp (increased membrane permeability),substitution of the 93th codon of fabI; fabI(G93V), substitution of Gly(the 93th codon) of fabI with Val
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Total RNA extracted using RNAprotect Bacterial Reagent (Qiagen) and an RNeasy Mini kit (Qiagen).
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: The purified RNA (40 mg) was mixed with 2 mL of bacterial random primer (3 mg/mL), 10mL 5xFirst strand buffer (Invitrogen) 5 mL 0.1M DTT, 1 mL 50xaminoallyl-dNTP mixture (0.5 mM each of dATP, dGTP, dCTP and dTTP), 1mL RNasin (40 U/mL) (Promega) and 2 mL reverse transcriptase (200 U/mL) (Invitrogen), and was incubated at 42°C for 1 h. After a further incubation with 1 mL reverse transcriptase (200 U/mL) at 42 °C for 1 h, 16.5 mL 1M NaOH and 16.5 mL 0.5 M EDTA were added to the mixture and incubated at 65 °C for 15 min to degrade the RNA. HCl (16.5 mL, 1M) was added to neutralize the mixture. The synthesized cDNA mixtures were purified using Microcon YM-30 (Millipore) and eluted. The purified cDNA was mixed with 1 m L 1M Na2CO3 (pH 9.0) and 2 mL Cy3-OSu or Cy5-OSu (Amersham Pharmacia Biotech) and incubated at room temperature for 1 h in the dark. The two labeled cDNA samples to be compared were purified using a QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen), and the eluted cDNA was dried by SpeedVac.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: The dried labeled probes were resuspended in 30 mL hybridization buffer (25% formamide, 5xSSC, 0.1% SDS, 10% dextran sulfate) and incubated at 95 °C for 5 min to denature the labeled probes. Each labeled probe was mixed and applied to the microarray slide and covered with a cover-slip. Hybridization was carried out in a humidified slide chamber (Corning) submerged in a 42 °C water bath for over 16 h. The cover-slips were removed by incubation for 1 min in wash buffer I (2xSSC and 0.1% SDS) prewarmed to 42 °C, and the slides were washed sequentially in washing buffer I at 42 °C for 10 min in the dark, washing buffer II (0.1xSSC and 0.1% SDS) at room temperature for 10 min in the dark, and twice in washing buffer III (0.1xSSC) at room temperature for 1 min. Finally, the slides were dried by centrifugation at 700 rpm for 5 min.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Scanned on a GenePix 4000B scanner (Axon Instruments). The resulting images were analyzed using GenePix Pro 6.0 software (Axon Instruments), and the data were imported into Genespring software for further analysis.
Sample.Data-Processing: LOWESS normalized, background subtracted data obtained from log2 of processed Red signal/processed Green signal. Agilent software GX 7.3 was used.

Sample.Title: Transcription profiles of NTG-treated E. coli imp fabI(G93V) and its control strain in the presence of triclosan

Channel.Source: NTG-treated E. coli imp fabI(G93V) [E. coli IFN5]
Channel.Characteristics: contains a 23 codon deletion allele in imp (increased membrane permeability),substitution of the 94th codon of fabI, NTG treatment; fabI(G93V), substitution of Gly(the 94th codon) of fabI with Val, NTG treatment to be high resistance to triclosan
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Treatment of sub-lethal triclosan; 50 mg/L triclosan
Channel.Growth-Protocol: The cells were cultivated in 100 ml LB broth containing 2 mg/L Cm with 50 mg/L triclosan and harvested in mid-logarithmic growth phase (OD600=1.1).
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Total RNA extracted using RNAprotect Bacterial Reagent (Qiagen) and an RNeasy Mini kit (Qiagen).
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: The purified RNA (40 mg) was mixed with 2 mL of bacterial random primer (3 mg/mL), 10mL 5xFirst strand buffer (Invitrogen) 5 mL 0.1M DTT, 1 mL 50xaminoallyl-dNTP mixture (0.5 mM each of dATP, dGTP, dCTP and dTTP), 1mL RNasin (40 U/mL) (Promega) and 2 mL reverse transcriptase (200 U/mL) (Invitrogen), and was incubated at 42°C for 1 h. After a further incubation with 1 mL reverse transcriptase (200 U/mL) at 42 °C for 1 h, 16.5 mL 1M NaOH and 16.5 mL 0.5 M EDTA were added to the mixture and incubated at 65 °C for 15 min to degrade the RNA. HCl (16.5 mL, 1M) was added to neutralize the mixture. The synthesized cDNA mixtures were purified using Microcon YM-30 (Millipore) and eluted. The purified cDNA was mixed with 1 m L 1M Na2CO3 (pH 9.0) and 2 mL Cy3-OSu or Cy5-OSu (Amersham Pharmacia Biotech) and incubated at room temperature for 1 h in the dark. The two labeled cDNA samples to be compared were purified using a QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen), and the eluted cDNA was dried by SpeedVac.

Finally, the slides were dried by centrifugation at 700 rpm for 5 min.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Scanned on a GenePix 4000B scanner (Axon Instruments). The resulting images were analyzed using GenePix Pro 6.0 software (Axon Instruments), and the data were imported into Genespring software for further analysis.
Sample.Data-Processing: LOWESS normalized, background subtracted data obtained from log2 of processed Red signal/processed Green signal. Agilent software GX 7.3 was used.

Series.Title: E. coli imp fabI(G93V) Mutant Cells: Control (E. coli imp fabI(G93V) ) vs. NTG-treated E. coli imp fabI(G93V)
Series.Summary: Transcriptional profiling of NTG-treated E. coli imp fabI(G93V) cells compared to control cells (E. coli imp fabI(G93V) ) in the absence or presence of sub-lethal concentration of triclosan.
Series.Overall-Design: Two-condition experiments with NTG-treated E. coli imp fabI(G93V) vs. control E. coli imp fabI(G93V). Biological replicates: 1 control (E. coli imp fabI(G93V) cell), 1 sample (NTG-treated E. coli imp fabI(G93V) cell), independently grown and harvested. Two replicate per array.
